(STORY)
Add to word list

serially adverb
(CRIME)
in a way that occurs over and over again, especially as a crime or bad act : The doctor was accused of serially abusing patients. It was later discovered that he had been serially cheating on his wife of 30 years.
More examplesFewer examplesI believe that the president has been serially dishonest in this matter.
